hints.content:
Find $9$ on the scale of the graph.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Season and the vertical axis labeled Lemons on Addison’s Tree. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, and 27. The bar line for each season shows the following: Winter bar line extends to 3, Spring bar line extends to 15, Summer bar line extends to 21, and Autumn bar line extends to 12. A red line is drawn to the right from 9 across the graph. !

hints.content: On the scale, all bars ending below $9$ show numbers less than $9$.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Season and the vertical axis labeled Lemons on Addison’s Tree. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, and 27. The bar line for each season shows the following: Winter bar line extends to 3, Spring bar line extends to 15, Summer bar line extends to 21, and Autumn bar line extends to 12. A red line is drawn to the right from 9 across the graph. Winter bar below the red line is highlighted. !

hints.content: Addison's lemon tree had fewer than $9$ lemons in winter.

question.content:
Addison graphed the number of lemons that grew on her lemon tree during the past four seasons.


[[☃ image 1]]

**During which of the following seasons did Addison's lemon tree have fewer than $9$ lemons?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Season and the vertical axis labeled Lemons on Addison’s Tree. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, and 27. The bar line for each season shows the following: Winter bar line extends to 3, Spring bar line extends to 15, Summer bar line extends to 21, and Autumn bar line extends to 12. !
